metadata.title: CVE-2022-21538 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Security: Encryption). Supported versions that are affected are8.0.29 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privilegedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQLServer. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorizedability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Server.CVSS 3.1 Base Score 3.1 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-21538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-router - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.30-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
mariadb-10.3 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
